result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W. Pederson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Report to Jail, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
14CM796 was dismissed and read in, along with uncharged DA cases 12EC3463 and 13EC1287
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 14CF623 and 14CM798

miscConds.notes:
No contact with J.M. N.H.
Not to use/possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia

Any treatment/programming per agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
07/02/19: Court Orders sentence credit of 117 days.
Concurrent with: 14CF623

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain high school diploma
Maintain full-time employment

No possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns or places that primarily serve alcohol
No possession or use of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia
No contact with victim, J.M. or her residence
Not to consume/possess prescription medications that are not prescribed to him

Follow all rules of supervision
Successfully complete any and all programming required by agent including AODA treatment
All court costs have been paid in full

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.
